00017 import tkinter, math

00023 class DrawingArea(tkinter.Canvas):
00024     """Enhanced Canvas widget for CAD drawings."""
00025     def __init__(self, master, xmlfile):
00026         tkinter.Canvas.__init__(self, master)
00027 
00028         self.master=master
00029         self.focus_force()
00030 
00031         self.xmlfile=xmlfile
00032         self.options=self.__parseXml()    # must be passed to the Canvas somehow - must be moved from here ;)
00033         self.psize=self.__pointSz()       # compute once/stay the same for the whole session
00034 
00035         self["background"] = "black"
00036         self.defaultFg = "white"
00037 
00038         self.scale_f2i=[0.1, 10]                                      # 100 mm at 10 pixels - should be moved to xml configuration file
00039         self.translatedFactor = [tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]  # only for integer representation of pixels; [h, w]
00040         self.zoomedFactor = 1.1                                       # zoom 10 %
00041 
00042         self.translatedFactor[0].set(0)
00043         self.translatedFactor[1].set(0)
00044 
00045         self.currentPos=[tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]
00046         self.currentDir=[tkinter.IntVar(), tkinter.IntVar()]
00047 
00048         self.csys={}
00049 
00050         # add data like self.points["label"]={"floatinfo":fkernel.point(**options),
00051         #                                     "intPosition":[x, y],
00052         #                                     "graphRepr":{}}
00053         self.points={}
00054         self.segments={}
00055         self.arcs={} # begin with a single type of an arc.
00056 
00057         self.faces={}
00058 
00059         # bindings
00060         self.bind("<Button-3>", self.__startRec)
00061         self.bind("<Motion>", self.__updateCurrentPos, add="+")
00062         self.bind_all("<Motion><ButtonRelease-3>", self.translate, add="+")
00063         self.master.bind("<MouseWheel>", self.zoom, add="+") # zoom MSWindows
00064         self.master.bind("<Button-4>", self.zoom, add="+")   # zoom Linux
00065         self.master.bind("<Button-5>", self.zoom, add="+")   # zoom Linux
00066 
00067     def __pointSz(self, size=0.5):
00068         """Computes the size as being size % of the root window max(width, height)."""
00069         a = max(int(size/100.0*float(self.master.winfo_screenwidth())),
00070                 int(size/100.0*float(self.master.winfo_screenheight()))) # always rounding towards zero
00071         if not a%2: a=a/2
00072         else: a=(a+1)/2
00073 
00074         return a
00075 
00076     def __parseXml(self):
00077         """Parse the canvas settings and if it is necessary the settings associated with the model."""
00078         pass
00079 
00080     def translate(self, event):
00081         self.move("translate", event.x-self.currentDir[0].get(), event.y-self.currentDir[1].get())
00082         # update the canvas integer coordinates of all the involved entities:
00083 
00084         # self.csys
00085         for i in list(self.csys.keys()):
00086             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]+=event.x-self.currentDir[0].get()
00087             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]+=event.y-self.currentDir[1].get()
00088         # self.points
00089         for i in list(self.points.keys()):
00090             self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]+=event.x-self.currentDir[0].get()
00091             self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]+=event.y-self.currentDir[1].get()
00092 
00093     def zoom(self, event): # scroll wheel zoom
00094         if event.num == 4: # scrolled up
00095             lfactor = self.zoomedFactor
00096         if event.num == 5: # scrolled down
00097             lfactor = 1.0/self.zoomedFactor
00098 
00099         # MSWindows
00100         if event.delta == 120: # scrolled up
00101             lfactor = self.zoomedFactor
00102         if event.delta == -120: # scrolled down
00103             lfactor = 1.0/self.zoomedFactor
00104 
00105         self.scale_f2i[1] *= lfactor
00106 
00107         # zoom csys
00108 
00109         for i in list(self.csys.keys()):
00110             # new
00111 
00112             xNew = lfactor*self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]+self.currentPos[0].get()*(1-lfactor)
00113             yNew = lfactor*self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]+self.currentPos[1].get()*(1-lfactor)
00114 
00115             self.move(i, xNew-self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0], yNew-self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1])
00116 
00117             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][0]=xNew
00118             self.csys[i]["intPosition"][1]=yNew
00119 
00120         # zoom points
00121         for i in list(self.points.keys()):
00122             # new
00123 
00124             xNew = lfactor*self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]+self.currentPos[0].get()*(1-lfactor)
00125             yNew = lfactor*self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]+self.currentPos[1].get()*(1-lfactor)
00126 
00127             self.move(i, xNew-self.points[i]["intPosition"][0], yNew-self.points[i]["intPosition"][1])
00128 
00129             self.points[i]["intPosition"][0]=xNew
00130             self.points[i]["intPosition"][1]=yNew
00131 
00132         # zoom lines
00133 
00134     def dispCsys(self, intPos, length=12, rotation=0, visible=1):  # length option [%] should be moved to xml canvas settings file
00135         """Graphically creates and display a coordinate system"""
00136 
00137         if visible == 1:
00138             state=tkinter.NORMAL
00139         else:
00140             state=tkinter.HIDDEN
00141 
00142         return [self.create_line(intPos[0], intPos[1], intPos[0]+int(length*self.psize*math.cos(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), intPos[1]-int(length*self.psize*math.sin(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), arrow=tkinter.LAST, fill=self.defaultFg, state=state),
00143                 self.create_line(intPos[0], intPos[1], intPos[0]-int(length*self.psize*math.sin(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), intPos[1]-int(length*self.psize*math.cos(rotation/180.0*3.14159)), arrow=tkinter.LAST, fill=self.defaultFg, state=state)] # 0x axis, Oy axis
00144 
00145     def dispPoint(self, intPos, representation, color, visible=1, filled=0):
00146         """Graphically creates and display on canvas a point entity"""
00147 
00148         if visible == 1:
00149             state=tkinter.NORMAL
00150         else:
00151             state=tkinter.HIDDEN
00152 
00153         if color == "default":
00154             color=self.defaultFg
00155 
00156         if filled ==1:
00157             fill=color
00158         else:
00159             fill=self["background"]
00160 
00161         if representation == "square": # to add possibility for active fill
00162             idPoint=self.create_rectangle(intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]-self.psize,
00163                                           intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+self.psize,
00164                                           outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00165         if representation == "circle":
00166             idPoint=self.create_oval(intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]-self.psize,
00167                                      intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+self.psize,
00168                                      outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00169         if representation == "triangle":
00170             idPoint=self.create_polygon(intPos[0], intPos[1]-int(2*self.psize*1.73/3.0),
00171                                         intPos[0]-self.psize, intPos[1]+int(2*self.psize*1.73/6.0),
00172                                         intPos[0]+self.psize, intPos[1]+int(2*self.psize*1.73/6.0),
00173                                         outline=color, fill=fill, state=state)
00174 
00175         return idPoint
00176 
00177     def setGlobalCsys(self): # length option [%] should be moved to xml canvas settings file
00178         """Creates the global coordinate system. """
00179 
00180         if "global" not in list(self.csys.keys()):
00181             self.csys["global"]={}
00182             self.csys["global"]["intPosition"]=[self.winfo_width()/2+self.translatedFactor[0].get(),
00183                                                 self.winfo_height()/2+self.translatedFactor[1].get()]
00184 
00185             self.csys["global"]["floatinfo"]=fkernel.csys([0.0, 0.0])
00186 
00187             # graphical stuff
00188             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]={}
00189             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["visible"]=1 # to modify this setting in order to be loaded from canvas xml settings file
00190             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"]=self.dispCsys([self.csys["global"]["intPosition"][0], self.csys["global"]["intPosition"][1]], rotation=0.0)
00191 
00192             self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["tags"]=["global", "csys", "translate"]
00193 
00194             for i in self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["tags"]:
00195                 self.addtag_withtag(i, self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"][0])
00196                 self.addtag_withtag(i, self.csys["global"]["graphRepr"]["entities"][1])
00197 
00198             # register the global coordinate system into the XML tree
00199             # like so <CSys id="global" parent="none" type="cartesian">0.0 0.0 0.0</CSys>
00200             g_csys=self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][0].createElement("Csys")
00201             g_csys.setAttribute('id', 'global')
00202             g_csys.setAttribute('parent', 'none')
00203             g_csys.setAttribute('type', 'cartesian')
00204             g_csys.appendChild(self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][0].createTextNode("0.0 0.0 0.0"))
00205             self.master.xmlprojfiles["geometry"][2][0].appendChild(g_csys)
00206 
00207     def float2int(self, csys_ints, reals, type_):
00208         """Transforms float coordinates into canvas coordinates."""
00209         # for now with no respect to the translation & zooming
00210         # but it can deal with polar coordinate systems
00211 
00212         if type_ == "polar": # determine the canvas local (with respect to csys_ints) coordinates in cartesian
00213             localv = reals[0]*math.cos(reals[1]/180.0*3.14159), reals[0]*math.sin(reals[1]/180.0*3.14159)
00214         else:
00215             localv = reals[0], reals[1]
00216         return [csys_ints[0]+int(localv[0]*self.scale_f2i[1]/self.scale_f2i[0]),
00217                 csys_ints[1]-int(localv[1]*self.scale_f2i[1]/self.scale_f2i[0])]
00218 
00219     def __updateCurrentPos(self, event):
00220         """updates the self.CurrentPos attribute with the current cursor position"""
00221         self.currentPos[0].set(event.x)
00222         self.currentPos[1].set(event.y)
00223 
00224     def __startRec(self, event):
00225         """records the event.x, event.y if the right click is pressed"""
00226         self.currentDir[0].set(event.x)
00227         self.currentDir[1].set(event.y)
